Q&A Data.Subject: ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes
Q&A Data.Question: What is ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes?
Q&A Data.Answer: ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes is a collection of post processing nodes for ComfyUI, which are designed to enable a variety of visually striking image effects.

Q&A Data.Subject: ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes
Q&A Data.Question: Where can I find examples of workflow outputs?
Q&A Data.Answer: Examples of workflow outputs are provided in the repo. Images with the workflow attached are located in the 'examples' directory and are named 'workflow_output.png' and 'example_workflow.png'.

Q&A Data.Subject: ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes
Q&A Data.Question: How can I submit more examples to the repo?
Q&A Data.Answer: You can submit more examples by contacting the repo maintainers or following the contribution guidelines specified in the repo documentation.

Q&A Data.Subject: ColorCorrect
Q&A Data.Question: What does ColorCorrect do?
Q&A Data.Answer: ColorCorrect adjusts the color balance, temperature, hue, brightness, contrast, saturation, and gamma of an image.

Q&A Data.Subject: ColorTint
Q&A Data.Question: What does ColorTint do?
Q&A Data.Answer: ColorTint applies a customizable tint to the input image, with various color modes such as sepia, RGB, CMY and several composite colors.

Q&A Data.Subject: KuwaharaBlur
Q&A Data.Question: What does KuwaharaBlur do?
Q&A Data.Answer: KuwaharaBlur applies an edge-preserving blur, creating a more realistic blur than Gaussian.

Q&A Data.Subject: PixelSort
Q&A Data.Question: What does PixelSort do?
Q&A Data.Answer: PixelSort rearranges the pixels in the input image based on their values, and input mask. It creates a cool glitch-like effect.

Q&A Data.Subject: Quantize
Q&A Data.Question: What does Quantize do?
Q&A Data.Answer: Quantize set and dither the amount of colors in an image from 0-256, reducing color information.

Q&A Data.Subject: Solarize
Q&A Data.Question: What does Solarize do?
Q&A Data.Answer: Solarize inverts image colors based on a threshold for a striking, high-contrast effect.

Q&A Data.Subject: ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes
Q&A Data.Question: How can I install these nodes?
Q&A Data.Answer: To install these nodes, you need to navigate to your '/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/' folder and run 'git clone https://github.com/EllangoK/ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes/'.

Q&A Data.Subject: ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes
Q&A Data.Question: How can I combine nodes?
Q&A Data.Answer: To combine nodes, you can use 'post_processing_nodes.py' by default. If you want a subset of nodes, you can run 'python combine_files.py [--files FILES [FILES ...]] [--output OUTPUT]' or 'python combine_files.py -h' for more help.
